intro: Isolobus corymbosus var. sparsiflorus, commonly known as the sparse-flowered isolobus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, pale pink or white flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
